questions.question_text: Which NSX CLI command is used to check the GENEVE tunnel status on ESXi transport node?

discussion.content:
A is correct.

get host-switch <host-switch-name> tunnels
Display Tunnels info on the specified host switch.

https://vdc-download.vmware.com/vmwb-repository/dcr-public/cc42e3c1-eb34-4567-a916-147e79798957/8264605c-a5e1-49a8-b603-cc78621eeeab/cli.html#get%20host-switch%20%3Chost-switch-name%3E%20tunnels

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct: https://vdc-download.vmware.com/vmwb-repository/dcr-public/28fdf409-4954-4ada-b9b7-63c2490af81d/aa8109b7-e2e9-4969-8541-eff94a0a2ab5/NSX-T%20Command-Line%20Interface%20Reference.html#get%20host-switch%20%3Chost-switch-name%3E%20tunnels

Selected Answer: A
is correct
A is correct

In Version 3.1.3.0.0.18328989 the command get host-switch <host-switch-name> tunnels does'n exist.
B is a posible answer

No, You are wrong. "Get host-switch" command is still exist at esxi which need use "nsxcli" command to enter NSX commandline at ESXi.

A is correct

please DO NOT provide wrong information if you don't familiar with NSX-T

A is correct as this refers to an ESXi transport node.

questions.question_text: What are two valid options when configuring the scope of a distributed firewall rule? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B&D are correct. From ICM manual:
A firewall rule includes parameters such as source, destination, service, profile, applied to, and logging, and defines which action should be taken on a rule match.
Applied To: Defines the scope of the rule. It can be the full DFW or a specific security group.
B,D are correct

Selected Answer: BD
BD is correct

questions.question_text:
Which two commands does an NSX administrator use to check the IP address of the VMkernel port for the GENEVE protocol on the ESXi transport node?
(Choose two.)

choices.E: esxcli network ip interface ipv4 get

discussion.content:
Correct answer is D,E
C is cant show ip address.
actually, answer D is esxcfg-vmknic -l (L), not -1 (one)

Selected Answer: DE
D E are correct

Selected Answer: DE
D & E are OK, the problem with option D is (I think) that was wrong writed because the used flag isn't -1 it had be -l.

Selected Answer: DE
DE is correct tested on transport node
D & E is correct answer as per this KB article. https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1008127
@yobserah Answer C you suggest is wrong because according your link "esxcli network nic list" means "list the Physical NICs currently installed and loaded on the system"

This answer looks wrong. To list interfaces use ESXCLI. Should be C&E. check here:

https://code.vmware.com/docs/11743/esxi-7-0-esxcli-command-reference/namespace/esxcli_network.html

comments.content: 'esxcli network nic list' shows detail of installed NICs but not include IP.

questions.question_text: Which command is used to display the network configuration of the Tunnel Endpoint (TEP) IP on a bare metal transport node?

discussion.content: A is correct. ifconfig is the right command
A ifocnifg is indeed correct- https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/installation/GUID-B7E7371E-A9F6-4880-B184-E00A62C0C818.html
A would be correct

ifconfig is for Linux
ipconfig is for Windows
A. ifconfig
I agree that A is the most probable solution. But what if were to be a Windows 2016 system?

comments.content: I think VMware's bare metal TEP uses a linux image

questions.question_text: Which three services are compatible with VRF Lite? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
The correct answer should be B,C,E.

Limitations of VRF Lite

VRF Lite is not compatible with the following services:
-VPN
-Load Balancer

Taken from NSX-T ICM 3.0 Lecture Manual.
A & D are wrong
BCE No VPN on VRF..on SR yep

Selected Answer: BCD
no vpn or load balancer

Also from ICM: These limitations apply only to the VRF gateway. You can connect a Tier-1 gateway configured with a load balancer or a VPN to a VRF gateway and that is fully supported.

So VPN and LB are still compatible / supported with VRF lite, just not on the VRF gateway.

Selected Answer: BCE
The following services cannot be configured in a VRF gateway: 
• VPN 
• Load balancer 
• OSPF routing

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE is correct

Selected Answer: BCE
VRF and LB are not configured in a VRF Gateway

Selected Answer: BCE
VRF lite is NOT compatible with VPN and LB

Confirmed - you need to use EVPN for VPN service as documented thoroughly on the Install, Configure, Manage pages/pdf. And confirmed for VRFs not supporting Load balancing by a VMware employee: https://communities.vmware.com/t5/VMware-NSX-Discussions/NSX-T-3-0-VRF-lite/td-p/1873495

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE correct as VRF Lite is not compatible with the following services: 

VPN 
Load Balancer
BCE are the correct choices
BCE are correct

Selected Answer: BCE
B C & E are correct

Selected Answer: BCE
The following services can not be configured in a VRF gateway: 
• VPN 
• Load balancer


-------------------------------------------------------------
VMware NSX-T Data Center: Install, Configure, Manage 
Lecture Manual 
NSX-T Data Center 3.0
5-138 
P.330

Selected Answer: BCE
The correct answer should be B,C,E.

Selected Answer: BCE
A & D are correct.

Should be B,C,E. Reason: https://communities.vmware.com/t5/VMware-NSX-Documents/VMware-NSX-T-Reference-Design/ta-p/2778093?attachment-id=102745 PG 74 

“Stateful services can either run on a Tier-0 VRF gateway or a Tier-1 gateway except for VPN and Load Balancing as these features are not supported on a Tier-0 VRF”

Answer: B C E
https://communities.vmware.com/t5/VMware-NSX-Documents/VMware-NSX-T-Reference-Design/ta-p/2778093?attachment-id=102745 
Page Number 74 bottom (PDF Page 75 because cover page)
“Stateful services can either run on a Tier-0 VRF gateway or a Tier-1 gateway except for VPN and Load Balancing as these features are not supported on a Tier-0 VRF”

The correct answer should be B,C,E.
Please refer to ICM training manual. Page 330 section 5-138
The correct answer should be B,C,E because VRF lite is 100% not compatible with VPN and Load Balancer.
The correct answer should be B,C,E.

I think he asking here about the vrf in general not in NSX-T 
VPN and load balancer are not compatible in vrf lite in NSX-T yes as per lecture manual
but also intrusion detection is an east-west service
